page.title: 01GAZATEER OF OUR AREA
page.content: This 12 sq. km.is a predominantly {rural area}which includes the only settlement of{Burley Woodhead.} The moorland road which travels diagonally across the grid divides the area into two distinct parts.To the {west is the open moorland}of{Ilkley {Moor}which forms the eastern fringe of {Rombald's Moor.}This area is a very popular tourist attraction.It is also used as{rough grazing land}for sheep. To the east of the road is an area which forms the southern slopes of the {Middle Wharfe Valley.}This area is {rich pasture farming land. The hamlet of{Burley Woodhead}is a daughter settlement of the larger village of{Burley-in-Wharfedale.}This is a highly desireable area for housing .Most of the{native {inhabitants}have now left, leaving a mainly{wealthy commuter community.
